newsitem.title: TURKEY: SOCCER-GALATASARAY OUT OF CUP AFTER 34-PENALTY THRILLER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-GALATASARAY OUT OF CUP AFTER 34-PENALTY THRILLER.

text.p: League leaders Galatasaray were knocked out of the Turkish Cup after losing 17-16 on penalties to first division rivals Genclerbirligi on Thursday night.

Galatasaray midfielder Ilyas Kahraman wept after missing the final and 34th spot-kick to hand the match to Genclerbirligi nearly three hours after their third round match kicked off. The teams finished level at 1-1 after extra time.

The previous Turkish scoring record was 9-8 after penalties in a cup match in the 1992-93 season but Thursday's epic fell narrowly short of the world record shoot-out score, set in 1988 when Argentinos Juniors defeated Racing Club 20-19.
